intro: Banisteriopsis schomburgkiana, commonly known as the "sacha inchi" or "wild pumpkin," is a tropical plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a climbing vine that produces small, green, egg-shaped fruits. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and yellow flowers. The seeds of the fruit are rich in omega-3 fatty acids and are highly nutritious. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of dense forests.
